div.p: Greetings. The same person who delivered my letter to you, Mr. Pisanus, a most courteous man, also delivered yours to me. Together with Bilioneus, I offered my services to him and did my utmost, motivated by your recommendation, which, as is fitting, held great weight with me.
Nor will I fail Bilioneus in the future, provided he wishes to make use of my services. And so much for that. I am surprised that you did not also send something to Mr. Haller when you wrote to me.

Everything is peaceful here; I would write to you about what is happening in the assembly if I thought you were unaware. Mr. Haugo, whom you wish to be greeted with your words, passed away some time ago, as I have written to you more than once. Hoser is quite well, except that old age, which is a disease in itself, is troublesome to him; he sends you his affectionate greetings.
Farewell, my most courteous Mr. Bullinger, and continue to love me.
To the most courteous and learned man Heinrich Bullinger, churchman of Zurich, and foremost friend.
